010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.regions.NeighborhoodType.N8;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
021
022/**
023 * Binary region segmenter based on a combined region labeling
024 * and contour tracing algorithm:
025 * F. Chang, C. J. Chen, and C. J. Lu. A linear-time component labeling
026 * algorithm using contour tracing technique. Computer Vision, Graphics,
027 * and Image Processing: Image Understanding 93(2), 206-220 (2004).
028 * Detected regions are 8-connected. 
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2020/04/01
032 */
033public class SegmentationRegionContour extends BinaryRegionSegmentation implements ContourTracer { 
034        
035        static private final int VISITED = -1;
036        
037        private List<Contour.Outer> outerContours;
038        private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours;
039        
040        /**
041         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmenter.
042         * @param ip A binary image with 0 values for background pixels and values &gt; 0
043         * for foreground pixels.
044         */
045        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip) {
046                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
047        }
048        
049        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType nh) {
050                super(ip, nh);
051                attachOuterContours();  // attach each outer contours to the corresponding region
052                attachInnerContours();  // attach all inner contours to the corresponding regions
053        }
054        
055        // public methods required by interface ContourTracer (others are in inherited from super-class):
056        
057        @Override
058        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours() {
059                return getOuterContours(false);
060        }
061        
062        @Override
063        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours(boolean sort) {
064                Contour.Outer[] oca = outerContours.toArray(new Contour.Outer[0]);
065                if (sort) {
066                        Arrays.sort(oca);
067                }
068                return Arrays.asList(oca);
069        }
070        
071        @Override
072        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() {
073                return getInnerContours(false);
074        }
075        
076        @Override
077        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours(boolean sort) {
078                Contour.Inner[] ica = innerContours.toArray(new Contour.Inner[0]);
079                if (sort) {
080                        Arrays.sort(ica);
081                }
082                return Arrays.asList(ica);
083        }
084        
085        // non-public methods ------------------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        @Override
088        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
089                // Create a label array which is "padded" by 1 pixel, i.e., 
090                // 2 rows and 2 columns larger than the image:
091                int[][] lA = new int[width+2][height+2];        // label array, initialized to zero
092                outerContours = new ArrayList<>();
093                innerContours = new ArrayList<>();
094                return lA;
095        }
096        
097        @Override
098        protected boolean applySegmentation() {
099                // scan top to bottom, left to right
100                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
101                        int curLabel = 0;       // reset label, scan through horiz. line:
102                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
103                                if (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) {    // hit an unlabeled FOREGROUND pixel
104                                        if (curLabel != 0) { // keep using the same label
105                                                setLabel(u, v, curLabel);
106                                        }
107                                        else {  // label == 0
108                                                curLabel = getLabel(u, v);
109                                                if (curLabel == 0) {    // new (unlabeled) region is hit
110                                                        curLabel = getNextLabel(); // assign a new region label
111                                                        //IJ.log(String.format("assigning label %d at (%d,%d), maxLabel=%d", label, u, v, maxLabel));
112                                                        int dS = 0;
113                                                        Contour.Outer oc = traceContour(u, v, dS, new Contour.Outer(curLabel));
114                                                        outerContours.add(oc);
115                                                        setLabel(u, v, curLabel);
116                                                }
117                                        }
118                                } 
119                                else {  // hit a BACKGROUND pixel
120                                        if (curLabel != 0) { // exiting a region
121                                                if (getLabel(u, v) == BACKGROUND) { // unlabeled - new inner contour
122                                                        int dS = (neighborhood == N8) ? 1 : 2;
123                                                        Contour.Inner ic = traceContour(u - 1, v, dS, new Contour.Inner(curLabel));
124                                                        innerContours.add(ic);
125                                                }
126                                                curLabel = 0;
127                                        }
128                                }
129                        }
130                }
131                return true;
132        }
133        
134        // Trace one contour starting at (xS,yS) in direction dS        
135        private <T extends Contour> T traceContour(int xS, int yS, int dS, T contr) {
136                int label = contr.getLabel();
137                int xT, yT; // T = successor of starting point (xS,yS)
138                int xP, yP; // P = previous contour point
139                int xC, yC; // C = current contour point
140                int[] pt = {xS, yS};  // start point
141                int dNext = findNextContourPoint(pt, dS);
142                contr.addPoint(Point.create(pt[0], pt[1]));
143                xP = xS; yP = yS;
144                xC = xT = pt[0];
145                yC = yT = pt[1];
146                
147                boolean done = (xS == xT && yS == yT);  // true if isolated pixel
148                while (!done) {
149                        setLabel(xC, yC, label);
150                        int[] pn = {xC, yC};
151                        int dSearch = (dNext + 6) % 8;
152                        dNext = findNextContourPoint(pn, dSearch);
153                        xP = xC;  yP = yC;      
154                        xC = pn[0]; 
155                        yC = pn[1]; 
156                        // are we back at the starting position?
157                        done = (xP==xS && yP==yS && xC==xT && yC==yT);
158                        if (!done) {
159                                contr.addPoint(Point.create(pn[0], pn[1]));
160                        }
161                }
162                return contr;
163        }
164        
165        static final int[][] delta = {
166                        { 1,0}, { 1, 1}, {0, 1}, {-1, 1}, 
167                        {-1,0}, {-1,-1}, {0,-1}, { 1,-1}};
168        
169        private int findNextContourPoint(int[] pos, int dir) {
170                // Starts at point pos in direction dir,
171                // returns the resulting tracing direction
172                // and modifies pt.
173                final int step = (neighborhood == N8) ? 1 : 2;
174                for (int i = 0; i < 7; i += step) {
175                        int x = pos[0] + delta[dir][0];
176                        int y = pos[1] + delta[dir][1];
177                        if (ip.getPixel(x, y) == BACKGROUND) {
178                                setLabel(x, y, VISITED);        // mark surrounding background pixels
179                                dir = (dir + step) % 8;
180                        } 
181                        else {  // found a non-background pixel (next pixel to follow)
182                                pos[0] = x; 
183                                pos[1] = y; 
184                                break;
185                        }
186                }
187                return dir;
188        }
189        
190        private void attachOuterContours() {
191                for (Contour c : outerContours) {
192                        int label = c.getLabel();
193                        BinaryRegion reg = findRegion(label);
194                        if (reg == null) {
195                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate outer contour with label " + label);
196                        }
197                        else {
198                                reg.setOuterContour(c);
199                        }
200                }
201        }
202        
203        private void attachInnerContours() {
204                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
205                        r.makeInnerContours();  // ensure that every region has a (empty) list of inner contours
206                }
207                for (Contour c : innerContours) {
208                        int label = c.getLabel();
209                        BinaryRegion reg = findRegion(label);
210                        if (reg == null) {
211                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate inner contour with label " + label);
212                        }
213                        else {
214                                reg.addInnerContour(c);
215                        }
216                }
217        }
218
219        // access methods to the label array (which is padded!)
220        @Override
221        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {     // (u,v) are image coordinates
222                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height)
223                        return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];        // label array is padded (offset = 1)
224                else
225                        return BACKGROUND;
226                //return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];      // original version
227        }
228        
229        @Override
230        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
231                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height) {
232                        labelArray[u + 1][v + 1] = label;
233                }
234        }
235

243//                      }
244//                      return cc;

247        
248}
